text:
Elements that use the nullable attribute and are complex or simple types that 
have facets that prevent empty data does not appear to satisfy requirement 
2.6.2 xsi:null in the XML Schema Part 1: Structures, W3C Candidate 
Recommendation 24 October 2000.

"XML Schema: Structures introduces a mechanism for signaling that an element's 
content is missing, or "null" in the terminology of databases. An element has 
null content if it has the attribute xsi:null with the value true. An element 
so labeled must be empty, but can carry attributes if permitted by the 
corresponding complex type."

In the case were the facet would prevent the data of an element from being 
empty, the rules for the facets are applied to the elements data despite it 
being marked as null in the instance document.

Examples:

Sample schema

<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2000/10/XMLSchema"
	 targetNamespace="http://www.test.org/Test"
	 xmlns="http://www.test.org/Test"
	elementFormDefault="qualified">

<xsd:element name="closing" type="ClosingType"/>
 <xsd:complexType name="ClosingType">
   <xsd:sequence>
	<xsd:element name="property" type="PropertyType" minOccurs="0" 
maxOccurs="1"/>		
	<xsd:element name="closing-status" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" 
nullable="true">
	  <xsd:simpleType >
	    <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
	      <xsd:enumeration value="Open"/>
	      <xsd:enumeration value="Closed"/>
	    </xsd:restriction>
	  </xsd:simpleType>
	</xsd:element>
  </xsd:sequence>	
</xsd:complexType>

<xsd:complexType name="PropertyType">
  <xsd:sequence>		
    <xsd:element name="address" type="AddressType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"  
nullable="true" />	
  </xsd:sequence>
</xsd:complexType>

<xsd:complexType name="AddressType" >
  <xsd:sequence>		
    <xsd:element name="street1" type=”xsd:string” minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" 
nullable="true"/>
    <xsd:element name="city" type=”xsd:string” minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" 
nullable="true"/>
    <xsd:element name="state-code" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" nullable="true">
      <xsd:simpleType>
        <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
          <xsd:maxLength value="2"/>
	</xsd:restriction>
      </xsd:simpleType>
    </xsd:element>		
    <xsd:element name="zip-code" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" nullable="true">
      <xsd:simpleType>
        <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string">
          <xsd:maxLength  value="10"/>
          <xsd:minLength value="5"/>
          <xsd:pattern value=" ([0-9]{5})|([0-9]{5}-[0-9]{4})|([0-9]{9}) "/> 
        </xsd:restriction>
      </xsd:simpleType>
    </xsd:element>				
  </xsd:sequence>
</xsd:complexType>
</xsd:schema>

Sample Instance:

<closing xmlns= “http://www.test.org/Test” 
xmlns:xsi=”http://www.w3.org/2000/10/XMLSchema-instance”
xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.test.org/Test"> 
     <property>
          <address>
                <street1>Some Street</street1>
                <city>Some City</city>
                <state-code>NY</state-code>
                <!—Will cause parser error, that the data does not meet the 
minLength facet-->
	   <zip-code xsi:null=”true”></zip-code>	
          </address>
     </property>
     <!—Will cause a parser error, that the data cannot be empty that it must 
be one of the 
enumeration values-->
     <closing-status xsi:null="true"></closing-status>      	
</closing>

text:
It is not a bug. We did not support nillable feature for 1.3.1. 
Please, note, nullable was changed to nillable. See updated PR schema specs.
Implementation of Nillable was committed to CVS a week ago.
